data.title: Cold War Berlin: Confrontations, Cultures, and Identities 9781788310710, 9780755602797, 9780755602780
data.meta_description: No other European city can claim to have experienced such division and togetherness as Berlin. This volume of essays att...

Cover

Contents

List of Figures

Introducing Cold War Berlin

Part 1 Locating Berlin in the Cold War

1 From Heart of Darkness to Heap of Rubble: Berlin as Nazi Capital Christoph Kreutzmüller

2 Division of the Spoils: Berlin as Symbol and as Prize David E. Barclay

3 Policing the Border Area in East Berlin: Rules, Conflicts, and Negotiations, 1961–89 Gerhard Sälter

4 Kennedy, Khrushchev, King, and Springsteen: Staging Visits in a Divided City Andreas Etges

Part 2 Disjointed and Resilient Local Entanglements in the Cold War

5 From Old War to Cold War: Berlin as Urban Planning Laboratory in the First Postwar Years Clara M. Oberle

6 Entangled Entertainment: Cinema and Television in Cold War Berlin Hanno Hochmuth

7 The Politics of Subculture in Both Berlins Timothy Scott Brown

8 Living in the Shadow of the Wall: Berlin’s Turkish Community, 1961–89 Sarah Thomsen Vierra

9 Experimental Art and Cultural Exchange in Late Cold War Berlin Briana Smith

10 Behind the Wall, Across the Wall: Gay Activism in East Berlin Teresa Tammer

11 Exhibiting Berlin: Local History in Berlin’s Museums Andreas Ludwig

12 Performing Berlin: The Rivaling 750th Anniversaries of 1987 Krijn Thijs

Part 3 Berlin’s Memory Culture

13 Divided Memory in United Berlin Stefanie Eisenhuth

14 Border Fragments, Border Fantasies: Cold War Berlin in Retrospect Paul Steege
